subject: Re: Pluggable Selector considered harmful? (Re: [junit] Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4)
msgSnippet: ... Not true.  You would UnitTest it the same way as you test anything else. -- Jason Rogers I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but
messageBody:
On 02/02/2006 07:01 AM, Daryl Richter apparently said:
> On Feb 1, 2006, at 11:41 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > Ben Maurer wrote:
> >
> >> http://ocw.mit.edu/OcwWeb/Electrical-Engineering-and-Computer-
> >> Science/6-170Laboratory-in-Software-EngineeringFall2001/
> >> LectureNotes/index.htm
> >>>
> >>> I'd be very interested in your materials, as well, if they're
> >>> publicly
> >>> available. Thanks,
> >>
> >> That's pretty interesting. I like the formal introduction to JUnit.
> >
> > I noticed that the author points out the danger of using Pluggable
> > Selector and reflection in general.
> >
> > What's up with that? Why do so many people find reflection so
> > dangerous?
>
>
> They don't have good Unit Tests?
Not true. You would UnitTest it the same way as you test anything else.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
